data.title: Finch.com
data.text:
Community

Coverage of community events and festivals.

TBA

August 18, 2023 - National Ethnic Press at CNE

January 21, 2021 - The Morning Shift Interview

November 29, 2020 - CBC The Doc Project

September 19, 2020 - International Peace Festival

November 15, 2019 - CEMA Awards

November 9, 2019 - Boat People Monument

September 12, 2019 - Mark Simms Medal

August 18, 2019 - National Ethnic Press at CNE

June 1, 2019 - Culture Magazin Interview

April 7, 2019 - Judy Sgro Volunteer Appreciation

December 30, 2018 - Mediation Station Interview

December 5, 2018 - Canada's Volunteer Awards

November 9, 2018 - CEMA Awards

November 8, 2018 - CBC Metro Morning

Aug. 18, 2018 - National Ethnic Press at CNE

August 9, 2018 - Now Toronto: Jane Finch Voices

June 15, 2018 - 150 Extraordinary Canadians

April 30, 2018 - Ottawa Freedom Flag Ceremony

April 28, 2018 - Toronto Freedom Flag Ceremony

Apr. 19, 2018 - Volunteer Toronto Legacy Awards

Jan. 23, 2018 - Grey Cup at Jane-Finch

Dec. 22, 2017 - G.H.E.T.T.O. Stories Interview

Nov. 24, 2017 - One Heritage Canada Mazagine

Nov. 24, 2017 - Heritage Beyond Borders

Nov. 17, 2017 - National Ethnic Press Awards

Oct. 15, 2017 - Mediation Station

Sep. 16, 2017 - CBC Our Toronto

Aug. 31, 2017 - Sovereign's Medal for Volunteers

Aug. 28, 2017 - CBC Metro Morning

Aug. 20, 2017 - National Ethnic Press at CNE

Jul. 1, 2017 - Parade of Nations

Apr. 26, 2017 - June Callwood Award

Apr. 20, 2017 - Roger McTair Celebration

Paul Nguyen receives the June Callwood Outstanding Achievement Award for Voluntarism from the Ontario Ministry of Citizenship and Immigration. Ryerson University celebrates the career of writer and director, Roger McTair. He was one of the first Black filmmakers in Canada and directed 1983's Home Feeling.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Jan. 21, 2017 - UVSA Ontario Professional Mixer

Nov. 26, 2016 - Regent Park Film Festival

Paul Nguyen gives a keynote speech at the United Vietnamese Students' Association of Ontario's (UVSA) Professional Mixer at the University of Toronto. The Regent Park Film Festival hosted a panel on Digital Activism and Black Lives Matter. Paul Nguyen spoke about how filmmaking can build a stronger community.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Nov. 2, 2016 - Queen's University Panel

Oct. 24, 2016 - Soulful Image Magazine

Paul Nguyen joins a panel of independent publishers to speak about Alternative Media: Advocacy, Dissent and Independent Journalism in Canada at Queen's University. Paul Nguyen is featured as one of Ten Men of Inspiration in a special edition of Soulful Image Magazine.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Oct. 23, 2016 - Hubbard Park Opening

Sep. 29, 2016 - LIFT Panel Discussion

Paul Nguyen attends the Hubbard Park Opening as a previous recipient of Toronto's William Hubbard Award. William Peyton Hubbard was the first black elected politician in Canada. Paul Nguyen and Blacus Ninjah join a panel discussion with multidisciplinary artists to speak about media arts and community engagement at LIFT.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Sep. 19, 2016 - Subdivived Book Reading

Aug. 21, 2016 - National Ethnic Press at CNE

Paul Nguyen joins co-authors Sarah Beamish, Fatima Syed and editor John Lorinc to do a public reading and Q&A of the book Subdivided at Toronto City Hall Library. Jane-Finch.com joins the National Ethnic Press and Media Council of Canada for the official opening of the annual pavilion at the 2016 Canadian National Exhibition.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Jul. 20, 2016 - UNITYFest

Jul. 13, 2016 - Career Buzz Interview

Paul Nguyen and Blacus Ninjah lead the kick-off of UNITY Fest with a discussion on how they combined the power of hip hop and the internet to fight negative stereotypes. Blacus Ninjah and Paul Nguyen discuss Jane-Finch.com and their upcoming speech at the 8th annual Unity Festival with Career Buzz host Nicole Hamilton on CIUT 89.5FM.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Jun. 1, 2016 - Culture Magazin

May 24, 2016 - Subdivided Book Launch

Paul Nguyen is profiled in the June 2016 edition of Culture Magazin. Paul talks about his work in the Jane-Finch community and receiving the Meritorious Service Medal. Paul Nguyen joins Canadian hip hop artist Ian Kamau and Manifesto co-founder Ryan Patterson at the launch of Jay Pitter and John Lorinc's essay anthology, Subdivided.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

May 12, 2016 - Ontario Volunteer Service Awards

Jan. 22, 2016 - Healthy Minds Canada

Long time Jane-Finch.com volunteers, rapper Blacus Ninjah and producer Kevin Douglas, receive the 2016 Ontario Volunteer Service Award. Paul Nguyen speaks at Healthy Minds Canada's inaugural ACT! workshop to educate, empower, and build resilience in children regarding their mental health.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Dec. 11, 2015 - Community Media Convergence

Dec. 11, 2015 - Meritorious Service Decorations

Jane-Finch.com picks up two awards from Community Media Convergence for Most Significant Impact and Most Innovative Use of Interactivity.

Paul Nguyen receives the Meritorious Service Medal (Civil Division) from His Excellency the Right Honourable David Johnston, Governor General of Canada.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Dec. 8, 2015 - CBC Metro Morning Interview

Oct. 30, 2015 - National Ethnic Press Awards

Paul Nguyen speaks to CBC's Matt Galloway on Metro Morning about 'Uncle Bob' and receiving the Meritorious Service Medal from the Governor General of Canada.

David Nguyen receives the 2015 National Ethnic Press and Media Council of Canada Award for Social Media.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Oct. 7, 2015 - Mindfest Mental Health Conference

Sep. 4, 2015 - Newcomer Orientation Week

Paul Nguyen talks about diversity/immigration & mental health stigmas at the 2015 Mindfest mental health and wellness fair hosted by the University of Toronto's Department of Psychiatry.

Paul Nguyen congratulates graduates of the Newcomer Orientation Week (NOW) program at Jarvis Collegiate Institute.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Aug. 22, 2015 - National Ethnic Press at CNE

Jun. 15, 2015 - Volunteer Service Awards

Jane-Finch.com joins the National Ethnic Press and Media Council of Canada for the opening day of their annual pavilion at the 2015 Canadian National Exhibition.

Paul Nguyen and Chris Williams receive the 10 year Ontario Volunteer Service Award for their community work in the Jane-Finch area.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Jun. 15, 2015 - PSR Canada Award

May 14, 2015 - Hong Fook Press Conference

Psychosocial Rehabilitation Canada names Paul Nguyen the 2015 National Ambassador at the Pioneer Awards held in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Paul Nguyen speaks about mental health stigmas at the Hong Fook Mental Health Association press conference for the 2015 Blossom of Hope Gala.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Apr. 18, 2015 - Tom Berner Award

Feb. 19, 2015 - Lunar New Year

Paul Nguyen receives the 2015 Tom Berner Award at the 28th annual Images Festival for providing extraordinary support to the cause of independent filmmaking in Toronto

Paul Nguyen celebrates Chinese Lunar New Year at the Scarborough Town Centre alongside VIP guests, Toronto Mayor John Tory, MPP Brad Duguid, Councillor Norm Kelly and Chin Lee.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Jan. 21, 2015 - Speaking at Humber College

Dec. 6, 2014 - York West Centennial Medal

Paul Nguyen was invited to speak to second year journalism students at Humber College. Paul shared strategies on how to gain access to stories and building relationships within the community.

Jane-Finch.com receives the York West Centennial Medal from MP Judy Sgro to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the York West riding.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Oct. 6, 2014 - OPDI Lighthouse Awards

Aug. 17, 2014 - National Ethnic Press at CNE

Paul Nguyen received the Pay It Forward Award at the 5th annual OPDI Lighthouse Awards dinner at the Holiday Inn Toronto-Yorkdale.

Jane-Finch.com joins the National Ethnic Press and Media Council of Canada for the opening day of their annual pavilion at the 2014 Canadian National Exhibition.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

May 14, 2014 - 15th Annual SVEMA Conference

May 5, 2014 - World Press Freedom Day

Mark Simms and Paul Nguyen speak at the 15th annual Saskatchewan Visible Minority Employees Association conference in Regina.

Paul Nguyen attends the reception for World Press Freedom Day hosted by the National Ethnic Press and Media Council of Canada at Toronto City Hall.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Apr. 23, 2014 - Public Heroes Awards

Feb. 25, 2014 - NOISE Dialogue Session

Sue Chun and David Nguyen attend the 2014 Public Heroes Awards to support first responders in the Greater Toronto Area.

Paul Nguyen spoke to students at York University's NOISE Project about his community work.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Feb. 22, 2014 - Rotaract Case Competition

Jan. 31, 2014 - Rotary Youth Impact Awards

Paul Nguyen joined the judging panel for the first annual Conflict Resolution Case Competition hosted by the Rotaract Club of York University.

Paul Nguyen receives the 2014 Rotary Youth Impact Award from the Rotary Club of Toronto West for his dedication to helping at-risk youth.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Dec. 8, 2013 - NEPMCC Conference

Dec. 1, 2013 - Mediation Station Interview

David Nguyen attends the 2013 Professional Development Conference and Training Seminars hosted by the National Ethnic Press and Media Council of Canada.

Paul Nguyen, Sue Chun and Chris Williams talk about their work on Jane-Finch.com with Mediation Station host Gregg Fenten on CHHA Radio Voces Latinas 1610 AM.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Nov. 5, 2013 - North York Urban Hero Awards

Oct. 24, 2013 - U of T Health Symposium

Paul Nguyen receives the 2013 North York Urban Hero Award at Centerpoint Mall. The ceremony celebrated individuals and groups for various contributions in North York.

Paul Nguyen presents 'How To Engage At-Risk Youth' at the Healthier Cities and Communities Symposium organized by The University of Toronto's Dalla Lana School of Public Health.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Aug.17, 2013 - National Ethnic Press at CNE

May 26, 2013 - Aroni Image Awards

The National Ethnic Press and Media Council of Canada opened its annual exhibit at the 2013 Canadian National Exhibition with a ribbon cutting ceremony.

Jane-Finch.com was honoured for their community work with the Aroni Image Award for Youth and Media at packed gala hosted at the Daniels Spectrum in Regent Park.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

May 26, 2013 - CTV Interview

Mar. 23, 2013 - 17th J.S. Woodsworth Awards

CTV News Toronto featured Jane-Finch.com founder Paul Nguyen about his work in the community and being a recipient of the 2013 Aroni Image Award.

Andrea Horwath presented the J.S. Woodsworth Human Rights Awards in Toronto. Jane-Finch.com received a certificate of appreciation for their work against racial discrimination.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Dec. 5, 2012 - Identify 'N Impact Awards

Nov.19, 2012 - National Ethnic Press Gala

Jane-Finch.com received the Equity and Diversity Award at the 2012 Identify 'N Impact Awards. The awards celebrate contributions young people make to communities in Toronto.

Paul Nguyen received the Recognition Award from the National Ethnic Press and Media Council of Canada.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Nov. 9, 2012 - National Ethnic Press Award

Oct. 17, 2012 - CRRF Symposium

Paul Nguyen received the National Ethnic Press and Media Council of Canada. The ceremony was held inside the Lieutenant Governor's Suite at Queen's Park.

Mark Simms spoke at the Canadian Race Relations Foundation's 2012 Award of Excellence and Symposium: Race, Faith, and Belonging: Strengthening Citizenship Engagement in Canada.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Aug. 18, 2012 - First Step Summer Camp

Aug. 10, 2012 - Pass It On!

Paul Nguyen gives a speech about leadership to the youth participants at First Step Summer Camp hosted by the Vietnamese Association of Toronto.

Paul Nguyen was a guest speaker at Pass It On! Cultivating Youth Leaders for our Community at the Hotel Arts in Calgary, Alberta.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Jun. 2, 2012 - VIVA Gala

May 22, 2012 - Asian Heritage Month

Mar. 28, 2012 - Association for Canadian Studies

Nov. 2, 2011 - Canadian Race Relations

Oct. 4, 2011 - Heritage Toronto Awards

Aug. 16, 2011 - World Literacy Canada

Jul. 23, 2011 - Covenant Chapel Awards

Jun. 27, 2011 - Newcomer Champion Awards

Jun. 22, 2011 - The Link with Marc Montgomery

Jun. 15, 2011 - Volunteer Service Awards

May 25, 2011 - IABC Toronto Ovation Awards

Nov. 26, 2010 - Viet Canadian Federation

Oct.23, 2010 - Ukrainian National Federation

Sep. 22, 2010 - Innoversity 2010

Paul Nguyen spoke at the 36th Ukrainian National Federation Convention in Montreal, Quebec. Paul talks about Jane-Finch.com and promoting multicultural understanding.

Paul Nguyen joins the discussion panel for the Innoversity Summit's 2010 workshop, Citizen 2.0. The summit was held at the Toronto Reference Library.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Jul. 4, 2010 - VAT Community Picnic

Jun. 1, 2010 - Dictionary Project

The Vietnamese Association of Toronto held a community picnic at Northwood Park. All members of the community were invited for free food and activities. The Don Mills Rotary Club held another great Dictionary Project again this year by providing free Miriam Webster dictionaries to under-privileged Grade 5 students in Toronto.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Jun. 18, 2009 - Goldhawk Live at Yorkwoods

Jun. 13, 2008 - Jane-Finch Peace Walk

Goldhawk Live presented a live on-location TV broadcast special at Yorkwoods Public School. The future of Jane and Finch was discussed with a live community audience. The Jane-Finch Peace Walk took place on June 13, 2009. Community residents marched together to promote a peaceful community and to protest gang violence.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Aug. 6, 2008 - The Bridge Ministry

Jun. 28, 2008 - My Roots

Mark Simms and Paul Nguyen visit The Bridge Ministry's annual general meeting. Mark and Paul shared their experiences working in Jane and Finch with the members of the fellowship. Mark Simms and Paul Nguyen visit Malvern to give a motivational talk to the kids in the My Roots program.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Jun. 17, 2008 - Peel Youth Violence Prevention

Apr. 23, 2008 - Peace By Peace Festival

Mark Simms and Paul Nguyen were guest speakers for the Peel Youth Violence Prevention Network. Mark Simms was the special guest MC for the 2008 Peace Festival at Downsview Park. Hundreds of students and teachers attended the festival that focused on anti-violence.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Mar. 14, 2007 - Black Creek United

Jan. 25, 2008 - St. Francis DeSales

In September 2007, the Art Gallery of York University organized Black Creek United, an interdisciplinary art workshop that took place at The Spot. Mark Simms visited Ms. DeSantis' class at St. Francis DeSales to give a presentation to the students. The class worked on murals to show their thoughts about living in the area.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Nov. 2, 2007 - United Way Screening

Aug. 18, 2007 - Together for Jesus Parade

The Ministry of Attorney General presents a United Way screening of CBC's Lost in the Struggle. Mark Simms and Paul Nguyen were in attendance to give a short presentation. Many local Churches in the Jane-Finch area and neighbors held the 2007 Together for Jesus caravan parade. The parade toured the streets along Driftwood Avenue.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Jul. 21, 2007 - Kiddie Caribana 2007

Apr. 18, 2007 - CBC Outfront

Kiddie Caribana 2007 took place in the parking lot of Yorkgate Mall. Paul Nguyen gives an audio tour of Jane-Finch and interviews local residents to get the real story behind the neighborhood's reputation. Produced by CBC's Laurence Stevenson.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Mar. 3, 2007 - Lost in the Struggle Discussion

Jan. 23, 2007 - Spirit Forum

Lost in the Struggle co-producers Mark Simms and Paul Nguyen visit a school to show the film to students and talk about their experiences during filming. Lost in the Struggle producers Mark Simms and Paul Nguyen give a speech to the Ontario Public Service Spirit Forum to encourage staff to volunteer more in needy areas.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Dec. 5, 2006 - Globe and Mail

Nov. 3, 2006 - Oakdale Movie Night

The Globe and Mail features Mark Simms in an article about the iron fences surrounding Toronto Community Housing projects. Oakdale Community Centre held a movie night for community residents to participate in a discussion about CBC's The Fifth Estate documentary, Lost in the Struggle.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Oct. 4, 2006 - Daytime Toronto Interview

Sep. 22, 2006 - CBC's The Fifth Estate

Paul Nguyen and Mark Simms appear on the Daytime Toronto talk show hosted by Anthony Regan and Myrocia Watamaniuk.

Jane-Finch.com teamed up with CBC's The Fifth Estate for the long-awaited documentary project, Lost in the Struggle.

Viewphoto gallery

View photo gallery

Aug. 9, 2006 - CHRY 105.5 FM Interview

Jul. 8, 2006 - Asian Night Market

Jul. 1, 2006 - Canada Day at Downsview Park

Jun. 17, 2006 - Driftwood Multicultural Festival

May 22, 2006 - Science Centre Trip

Mar. 27, 2006 - Much Music Interview

Mar. 21, 2006 - Omni Culture Interview

Mar. 6, 2006 - Jane-Finch.com Visits Oakdale

Feb. 21, 2006 - Governor General Visit

Feb. 2, 2006 - 100 Huntley Street

Jan. 25, 2006 - Friends of YPEC

Dec. 12, 2005 - Maestro Interview

Dec. 6, 2005 - Parm Gill Interview

Dec. 5, 2005 - Paul and Mark at Global

Jane-Finch.com reporter Sabrina Gopaul visit Conservative candidate Parm Gill at his campaign office to film an interview about his views on the upcoming election, focusing on York West.

Mark Simms and Paul Nguyen are invited to a special edition of Global National called The Real Deal: Politics Who Cares?

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Nov. 28, 2005 - Sounds Like Canada

Nov. 25, 2005 - Blacus on AM 640

Nov. 23, 2005 - Mark CityPulse Interview

Nov.23, 2005 - Mark on CityOnline

Jane-Finch.com producer Mark Simms is interviewed by CityPulse reporter Francis D'Souza. Mark talks about the controversy surrounding 50 Cent's upcoming concert tour in Canada.

Mark Simms appears as a guest on CityOnline hosted by Ann Rohmer. Mark discusses the impact of pop culture on society and talks about why the city shouldn't ban 50 Cent's tour.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Nov. 13, 2005 - Tiếng Nói Trẻ Music Video

Nov. 9, 2005 - CBC News

Jane-Finch.com producer Mark Simms shooting a music video for Tiếng Nói Trẻ's Vietnamese rock song.

Paul Nguyen appears on CBC Metro Morning hosted by Andy Barrie, while Mark Simms appears on CBC News. Later, Blacus Ninjah is interviewed by CBC's Mary Wiens.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Oct. 22, 2005 - Buck Studio

Aug. 24, 2005 - Speaking in Tongues Film

Sep. 16, 2005 - Mark on CityOnline

Sep. 8, 2005 - Mark & Paul on CityTV

Jane-Finch.com executive producer appears on CityOnline with host Laura DiBattista. Mark talks about ways to help the community and keeping kids out of trouble.

Mark Simms being interviewed by CityTV reporter Kris Reyes.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Aug. 30, 2005 - Master Mark DeZilva

Aug. 15, 2005 - Mark Simms on CityOnline

Jane-Finch.com's community coordinator Mark DeZilva appeared on CityTV last night. Mark DeZilva talks about the community and the positive steps that need to be done. Jane-Finch.com producer Mark Simms joins Ontario NDP leader Howard Hampton and CityTV host Ann Rohmer for a discussion on ways to counter the recent rash of gun violence.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Aug. 15, 2005 - Mark on Canada AM

Aug. 8, 2005 - Mark on CityOnline

Mark Simms is interviewed by Canada AM host, Beverly Thomson. The segment aired across Canada on the CTV network as Mark reflects on growing up in our neighborhood.

Mark Simms joins CityOnline hosted by Laura DiBattista. Mark is featured on a panel to discuss about community safety initiatives and programs.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Jul. 14, 2005 - Brookview Summer Camp

Jul. 12, 2005 - CKLN 88.1 FM Interview

Paul Nguyen and Mark Simms visit Brookview Middle School as guest speakers for summer camp. They gave a short motivational lecture and martial arts and fitness lessons to the students. Paul Nguyen, Mark Simms, Chris Williams and rapper Chuckie Akenz are interviewed by Word of Mouth host Semhar Woldeyesus on CKLN 88.1 FM.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

May 21, 2005 - G4 Tech TV Canada Interview

May 13, 2005 - CPMA Convention and Tradeshow

Webmaster Paul Nguyen and the Jane-Finch.com team including, Mark Simms, Andrei Petrik and Chuckie Akenz gather for an interview by Omni TV personality Pay Chen.

Mark Simms and Paul Nguyen attend the Canadian Produce Marketing Association at the Metro Toronto Convention Centre to learn about new product innovations.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Mar. 31, 2005 - Northwood Celebration Mar. 29, 2005 - CHRY 105.5 FM Interview

Northwood Neighborhood Services celebrated their 23rd year in operation. Among the attendees was the Driftwood Community Centre Vietnamese Senior's group.

Paul Nguyen joins host Boran Plong and Golden Child on CHRY 105.5 FM for a radio interview to talk about Jane-Finch.com.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Mar. 25, 2005 - CityPulse Interview Mar. 22, 2005 - Chuckie at York University

CityPulse anchor Dwight Drummond interviews Paul Nguyen, Mark Simms and Chuckie Akenz. They about the website and issues concerning the community.

Chuckie Akenz appears as a guest speaker at York University. He spoke about the Asian-Canadian experience for a humanities course shown here.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Mar. 1, 2005 - Lecture at Westview Feb. 28, 2005 - Ryerson Lecture

Jane-Finch.com staff Mark Simms, Paul Nguyen and Chuckie Akenz were among the guest speakers for Westview's first W.A.S.A.P. student meeting.

Director Paul Nguyen and Flow 93.5 morning show host, Jemeni, as guest speakers at a recent Ryerson University journalism course lecture.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Feb. 1, 2005 - Global National Interview Mar. 3, 1999 - Much Music Stop Racism Awards

Paul Nguyen and Chuckie Akenz were featured on Global National. They were interviewed about the website's growing success and impact in the community.

Paul Nguyen and Chris Williams are among the 10 national winners across Canada in Much Music's Stop Racism Video Competition. The awards showed aired in 1999.

View photo gallery

View photo gallery

Jun. 11, 2004 - Academy of Martial Arts The Academy of Martial Arts & Sciences is now offering a summer camp program for children. Activities include games, swimming, park training, soccer, sumo wrestling, taekwondo training, karate, water balloon fights, movies and much more. Contact Master Dezilva at 647-828-1102.
